title: Climate change: How 1.5C degrees of global warming could change the world
text:
Video

Leading climate scientists say in order to stop global warming from exceeding 1.5C and causing a "climate catastrophe" urgent steps need to be taken now.

Research by the UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change shows the world is now completely off track, heading instead towards 3C - twice the recommended rate of warming.

But how can just a few degrees make such a massive difference to our planet?

Why is 1.5 such an important number when it comes to climate change?

BBC Science reporter Laura Foster explains.

Follow Laura on Twitter.
description: Why a UN climate change report says global warming should be kept to 1.5C above pre-industrial levels.
